item.title: PyPI Was Subpoenaed
item.description: - The Python Software Foundation received three subpoenas for PyPI user data from the United States Department of Justice in March and April 2023.

item.title: The tiny corp raised $5.1M
item.description: - The tiny corp is a new computer company that aims to commoditize the petaflop and democratize access to AI compute.

item.title: The brand new Thunderbird logo
item.description: - Thunderbird has a brand new logo designed by Jon Hicks, the creator of the original Firefox and Thunderbird logos.

item.title: Simple exercise to eliminate gastroesophageal reflux (2022)
item.description: - A case report outlines a novel exercise for resistance training of the lower esophageal sphincter (LES) to eliminate gastroesophageal reflux.

item.title: The long road to recover Frogger 2 source from tape drives
item.description: - The author shares their story of recovering the source code for the game Frogger 2 from an OnStream tape drive.

item.title: Don't open the details in a modal window, have it be a separate page
item.description: - Using a modal window for detailed content is not necessary.

item.title: SectorC: A C Compiler in 512 bytes
item.description: - SectorC is a C compiler written in x86-16 assembly that fits within the 512 byte boot sector of an x86 machine, likely the smallest C compiler ever written.

item.title: Ask HN: How do you not take criticism of your work personally?
item.description: - A member of the Hacker News (HN) community asked how to avoid taking criticism of their work personally.

item.title: Walking naturally after spinal cord injury using a brainâ€“spine interface
item.description: - Scientists have developed a brain-spine interface that allowed three spinal-cord-injured patients to walk again with natural and balanced gaits.

item.title: Hypersonic missiles are misunderstood
item.description: - Hypersonic missiles are not new, and we have had them for decades.
